tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  Respected (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  EXTRA CREDIT (5)  Amazing lectures (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Hilarious (4)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Participation matters (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Kellar\'s lecture style is superb. He\'s super clear, makes things relevant, and only tests on lecture material. He records lectures. So glad I was able to take 201 with him, wish he taught 202, and am hoping to be able to take Path with him. He\'s also super helpful in office hours. Basically an ideal professor for tough material. Highly recommend!

tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  Respected (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  EXTRA CREDIT (5)  Amazing lectures (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Hilarious (4)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Participation matters (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Dr. Kellar is a great professor. His class is pretty difficult and the tests are pretty challenging as well, but he tries to make the class as much fun as it can be. He tries to be clear in his lectures and explains what is required for assignments. I love his jokes before class everyday! Great professor overall.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  Respected (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  EXTRA CREDIT (5)  Amazing lectures (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Hilarious (4)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Participation matters (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Dr. Kellar is a great help to any student willing to approach him, his humorous attitude and great jokes are something not to miss out on! Easily one of my most favorite professors I\'ve had. His material can be tough but because he records his lectures it allows one to look back on the lecture if something seems unclear. In office hours he is great

tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  Respected (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  EXTRA CREDIT (5)  Amazing lectures (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Hilarious (4)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Participation matters (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: I think that Dr. Kellar gives great lectures but the class is hard because the material is tough and there is a lot of it. He doesn\'t give a lot of homework, but you have really have to study to do well on the tests. He\'s super knowledgeable and makes the lectures interesting but I\'d recommend going to the SI\'s too if you want to do well.

stu_tags: HILARIOUS  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: The material is tough, there is no way around that but Kellar does a great job teaching it. He takes his time to answer student questions, and explains everything very thoroughly. His passion and knowledge are very obvious, and he does a great job of making somewhat dry material interesting. All tests based on lectures. He is also hilarious.

comments: Kellar was a fine teacher, I think it\'s just hard material, because sometimes things weren\'t very clear. The tests are hard if you don\'t study a lot, but they are passable. I would say get with a big study group, makes the material way easier. And do the online homework assignments for easy points

tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  Respected (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  EXTRA CREDIT (5)  Amazing lectures (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Hilarious (4)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Participation matters (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)
stu_tags: EXTRA CREDIT  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  TOUGH GRADER
comments: Kellar is hilarious and makes the lectures entertaining, but you won\'t pass if you skip them. I highly recommend taking the practice tests and printing out the powerpoint notes and adding your own notes in. I studied decently and had an A after midterms, but ended with a B. You can\'t drop a test, and the extra credit isn\'t much but it does help.

The test are tough and there is a lot of "b and c" "all of the above" "a and d" questions which make it difficult. You really have to know the information to do well.

comments: Kellar is an amazing professor. He is very clear in what he wants, is hilarious, gives great feed back and is the most inspirational professor I have had at NAU. Anatomy is a medially difficult subject, but Kellar makes it fun, engaging, and easy to learn. Also, I have the biggest man crush on him ever, so there\'s that.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  Respected (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  EXTRA CREDIT (5)  Amazing lectures (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Hilarious (4)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Participation matters (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  RESPECTED  AMAZING LECTURES
comments: Dr. Kellar is the best Bio professor I have ever had. His class is not easy but it really sets you up and prepares you for all of your upper level classes. You have to put in effort and you have to show up for class (4 times during the semester he does random extra credit for showing up). Very willing to help in office hours.

comments: This class contained challenging material but Dr. Kellar explains everything very well. You have to study a lot but it is worth it. I recommend Kellar for any course.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  Respected (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  EXTRA CREDIT (5)  Amazing lectures (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Hilarious (4)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Participation matters (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)
comments: Even though attendance is not mandatory, it is important to go to class and it is always a good experience. It is best to print out the lecture notes and bring them to class and then take notes on what he says. He records his lectures so that he can use his words on tests.
